name: ferison
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))

comment: "Ferison", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and some ` ph ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ps ` . Instance of ~ datisi . In Aristotelian notation, EIO-3: MeP and MiS therefore SoP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.)
